contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Kiyokawa'''|清川村|Kiyokawa-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Ōno District, Ōita|Ōno District]], [[Ōita Prefecture|Ōita]], [[Japan]]. On March 31, 2005 Kiyokawa was merged with the towns of [[Asaji, Ōita|Asaji]], [[Inukai, Ōita|Inukai]], [[Mie, Ōita|Mie]], [[Ogata, Ōita|Ogata]] and [[Ōno, Ōita|Ōno]], and the village of [[Chitose, Ōita|Chitose]], all from [[Ōno District, Ōita|Ōno District]], to form the new city of [[Bungo-ōno, Ōita|Bungo-Ōno]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,488 and the [[population density|density]] of 52.73 persons per km². The total area was 47.18 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Kiyokawa, Oita}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ōita Prefecture]] {{Oita-geo-stub}}
